message.content:
To estimate the average number of cereal bits per design, we divide the total number of cereal bits by the number of designs created. So 63 cereal bits divided by 9 designs equals approximately 7 cereal bits per design (since \( \frac{63}{9} = 7 \)).

Regarding whether she used an equal number in each, since we have a whole number result from our division and no remainder mentioned, it suggests that Emily most likely did use the same amount of cereal bits for every single design. However, without more detailed information on how exactly she distributed them (e.g., if some designs might require fewer or more), this is only an estimation based on average usage.
